page.title: 10ST.MARTIN de TOURS.<C.of E.>
page.content: Founded in 1739 by the Morice family, the church was later rebuilt on its present site at Werrington.It's got stained glass,a new roof and bells, though no bell ringers. Rev.J. Boatright, Vicar,and his wife have been here for 11 years.He also preaches at St.Giles and Virginstowe which are part of the parish.There is a service every Sunday morning with hymns and Holy Communion and Evening Service on the first Sunday in every month.About twenty seven families constitute the congregation.There are church officers, two church wardens and a church council.It also has a Sunday school attended by approximately nine children, who have instruction, paint and pray.The church also has a Mothers' union and such activities as flower festivals.There's a Harvest Festival Service in Autumn.
